title.native: 昭和元禄落語心中～助六再び篇～
title.romaji: Shouwa Genroku Rakugo Shinjuu: Sukeroku Futatabi-hen
title.english: Descending Stories: Showa Genroku Rakugo Shinju

description:
Unable to forget a performance of "Shinigami" performed by the rakugo master Yakumo in the prison where he was being held, Yotaro's first act upon his release was go right to the theater, where he begged, pleaded, and was finally accepted as Yakumo's live-in apprentice. After years of refining his art, Yotaro was promoted to the rank of Shinuchi and inherited the title of 3rd Generation Sukeroku. For the sake of his master Yakumo, Konatsu, and to change the image of Sukeroku inside them both, what kind of rakugo will Yotaro discover?

This celebrated human drama, based on a story by Haruko Kumota, offers an honest and sympathetic look into the lives and livelihoods of rakugo storytellers in the Showa era.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Rakugo
tags.description: Rakugo is the traditional Japanese performance art of comic storytelling.

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Elderly Protagonist
tags.description: The protagonist is either over 60 years of age, has an elderly appearance, or, in the case of non-humans, is considered elderly for their species.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Afterlife
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the afterlife.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Yakuza
tags.description: Centered around Japanese organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Inseki
tags.description: Features sexual or romantic relations among step, adopted, and other non-blood related family members.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

title.native: 昭和元禄落語心中
昭和元禄落語心中

node.description: Shinichi Omata is a Japanese director, storyboard artist, and former producer best known for directing Showa Genroku Rakugo Shinju (2016) and Kaguya-sama: Love is War (2019).

Kouji Tsujitani was a Japanese actor, voice actor, narrator, and director of audiography. Tsujitani used to be affiliated with Sigma Seven. He died of a stroke on October 17, 2018.

He was married to fellow voice actress [Kumiko Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/95248/).

__Machida Touko__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sakuribo)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/602807469)

A rakugoka, actor and independent filmmaker.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/gonakanishi)

Gou Nakanishi graduated with a degree from Waseda University's Faculty of Letter's, Arts and Sciences. Starting his career with King Records in 1997, he has been instrumental in developing popular artistes and anime hits such as Sokyuu no Fafner, Inukami and Negima!? He is also the producer of the hit Japanese pop band, angela.

[Website](www2s.biglobe.ne.jp/~neko22/) | [Profile](http://www.face-music.co.jp/2_artist/saito.htm)

**Real Name:** Takeshi Saitou (斎藤毅)
**Hometown:** Shibuya, Tokyo, Japan

Ringo Shiina is a Japanese singer, songwriter and musician. She is also the founder and frontwoman of the band Tokyo Jihen.

She describes herself as "Shinjuku-kei Jisaku-Jien-ya (新宿系自作自演屋, a Shinjuku-style writer-performer)". She was ranked number 36 in a list of Japan's top 100 musicians compiled by HMV in 2003.

Shiina is an accomplished musician and songwriter who writes music spanning numerous genres. She is well known for her eccentricity, rolling her "r"s and creating promotional music videos with striking visuals. She mainly plays rhythm guitar, but she plays other musical instruments. During live shows she sometimes plays the piano and occasionally plays the bass guitar. While recording, she sometimes plays piano and drums, and occasionally uses uncommon musical instruments such as a melodica and a shamisen.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [director](https://anilist.co/staff/149372/), different kanji._
